legge_1882.name: James Legge Translation (1882)
legge_1882.description: Original translation preserved from pyChing v1.2.2. James Legge's translation is one of the first complete English translations of the I Ching and remains widely respected for its scholarly accuracy.
legge_1882.notes: This is the canonical source for pyChing. All other sources are compared against and merged with this translation.

wilhelm_baynes.name: Wilhelm/Baynes Translation
wilhelm_baynes.description: Richard Wilhelm's German translation rendered into English by Cary F. Baynes. This translation is considered one of the most influential Western versions of the I Ching, featuring an introduction by Carl Jung.
wilhelm_baynes.notes: To be extracted and integrated. Requires web scraping and formatting.

legge_simplified.name: Simplified Legge (TwoDreams)
legge_simplified.description: A modernized, simplified version of James Legge's translation, making the archaic language more accessible to contemporary readers.
legge_simplified.notes: To be extracted. Maintains Legge's structure but updates language.

hermetica.name: Hermetica I Ching
hermetica.notes: PDF source requiring extraction and conversion. Verification of translation quality needed.

dekorne.name: Gnostic Book of Changes
dekorne.author: James DeKorne
dekorne.description: A Gnostic interpretation of the I Ching, offering an esoteric perspective on the traditional text.
dekorne.notes: HTML source. Represents alternative philosophical interpretation.
